{"step_by_step_thinking": "Amide group drugs are a type of local anesthetics. Xylocaine, also known as lidocaine, is an amide local anesthetic. Lignocaine is another name for lidocaine, so it is also an amide local anesthetic. Bupivacaine is also an amide local anesthetic. Procaine, on the other hand, is an ester local anesthetic, not an amide.", "answer_choice": "A"}
